tweet: I had an extremely hard time relating to my peers. Hanging out with, working with, and eventually moving into low-income housing with refugee neighbors was great for me. It was *expected* for me to be an outsider.

tweet: I took it so, so seriously. I never thought about my own desires or wants and this was highly praised. I went to Bible college to be a missionary bc that is the only logical conclusion if you believe it all. I was so confused why everybody else didnâ€™t do the same thing.

tweet: The difference between us is that as a young child I was given a â€œmapâ€ for how to be a human: I was a vessel for God and my lifeâ€™s work was to convert other people to Christianity. As an autistic kid, there was such relief in being explicitly told the rules!

tweet: My heart has been heavy the past few days thinking about violence against Asian-Americans. And also thinking about how few monuments or memorials we have for Japanese interment camps. It is all related. What we don't mourn, we perpetuate.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: She compared what the US was doing to Japanese-Americans as exactly what the Germans were doing--creating concentration camps. And because of this, the FBI opened a file on Dorothy Day, because she dared to tell the truth of what people were willing to accept in the name of war.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22

I have face blindness.
I cannot drive anywhere outside of my small neighborhood without google maps (even to family members houses).

tweet: And that, my friends, is a story of how two awkward and intense souls found each other at a very conservative Bible college. We've just been hanging out and being weird together ever since.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: and it turns out Krispin IS one of the best people in the world, and I DO like hairy guys, and after a couple of months of hanging out I told him I was going to have his children and already had the names picked out.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Our mutual friend talked us up to each other. He told me people should stand up and applaud when Krispin came into a room, that's how good of a guy he was. Our friend started driving us to coffee every Friday. Krispin started hanging out at the school library where I worked.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet:
so my friend yells out across the large classroom: HEY KRISPIN! LIFT UP YOUR SHIRT!

and this cute bearded guy, without missing a beat, just . . . lifted up his shirt. 

And I was like . . . wait a minute? Do I actually LIKE hairy guys? https://t.co/XfKVGGgsuu

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: I had a very gregarious friend at Bible college who was obsessed with how I had never dated anyone. One day at the end of our psych 101 class he asked me AGAIN what I liked in guys. At a total loss as to what a normal person would say, I said "um, I like hairy guys."

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: I was the manic pixie dream girl of Bible college. I did not like boys. I did not like anyone. I was weird, quirky, and destined to go live overseas. I had kissed dating goodbye. every time I tried to force myself to like someone (bc they liked me) I just couldn't do it.

tweet: @MollieMTindle yeah what we think of as "classic" symptoms are usually based off of white boys (who were the ones studied for research mostly). highly sensitive people + special interests (which can be religion! or God!) are a more expansive beginning framework

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: But one pretty sad realization is that hating myself was very much a part of my religious upbringing. It actually made me a better white evangelical woman in so many ways.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Anyways I am finally learning not to hate myself as I am going through the process of being diagnosed, 10/10 would recommend. Also. There are a lot less neurotypicals in the world than we think, it's just that all of our systems are set up to prioritize them.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: (ps I know you all are not ready for my #actuallyautistic tweets and that is totally ok. but if more people shared about their experience of late diagnosis, it could help some people learn to accept themselves. there is so much stigma and so much misinformation out there)

tweet: it's pretty sobering to realize how much hope I have lost in the systems around us to provide and protect for anyone. But you know what? I have hope in humanity because of people like my friend. the future is mutual aid. the future is searching for those slipping thru the cracks.

tweet: me and my friend sat and ate the snacks and she translated for me and for them and we tried to be helpful. but it hurts, it all hurts. for every person who makes it here, there are so many longing for safety. my friend carries them with her, always.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: this used to be my life and Trump and then COVID-19 changed everything. no more new families. it was surreal to be back in a bare apartment, scrabbling around for solutions and trying to figure out why so many people slip through the cracks.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: but of course they served us so much tea and so many snacks. I am overwhelmed by the complexities of our world and so many systemic failures. my friend, who is grieving her family members who cannot escape Afghanistan right now, is determined to help whoever she can.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: they've been here two weeks and their food stamps only started working three days ago. they have no wifi, phone, computer--and they don't speak English. I don't know of any in-person English classes happening bc of the COVID-19 surge we have right now.

tweet: having lots of feels today. a few months ago I was in a panic trying to help neighbors and friends apply for their loved ones to be evacuated from Afghanistan. nobody I spent hours advocating for made it through. but today me and my friend went to go visit one family who did.

tweet: I come from a family of three girls. our dad was a pastor, and has been our whole life.  me and my younger sister have been in Christian ministry for over a decade, now we are both out (burned out, more like it). my older sister never was into it like we were.

tweet: I know it doesn't always translate, but in my heart I am the Goodest little Good Girl. I always wanted the approval of others. I do not try to be at odds with my faith community, in fact it is a huge fear of mine. I was, and am, simply trying to take it seriously.

tweet: So that is what I tried to do in my book. Hone in on the electric, intense, deeply political and religious articles Dorothy wrote in her 8 page newspaper she put out every month. (also her as a complicated woman and mother, other things which get ignored).

tweet:
And if something doesn't work for my low-income neighborhood, then it isn't working. Period.

The future is mutual aid, localized care, much smaller institutions, and wide open eyes about the failure of our current system.

tweet: There is simply . . . no way to know/track/test COVID-19 in poorer neighborhoods. I know we have all known this for awhile, but to live in the midst of it . . . they will only shut the schools down if enough staff don't report to work at this point I believe.

tweet: Anyways Dorothy Day was a Christian anarchist, so spending the past few years hanging out with her words has been helpful. But my word. What little trust I had in the government (including public schools) has been completely eroded. And I know I can't be the only one.

hello, two years into a global pandemic, my government cannot make COVID-19 testing easily accessible or affordable to my low-income neighborhood. Yet the budget for the military is increased by 25 billion for 2022. 

I am officially an anarchist.

Older white evangelical men seemed to be obsessed with the idea of discovering what God's will was! And they loved rooting around in the lives of the patriarchs for the answers. 

And I was all like . . . have you ever read the sermon on the mount? It's actually quite explicit!

looking at Jesus
listening to people who have suffered a lot tell me about God

tweet: What depressed and sad people want to hear is that their sadness is not too much and not too overwhelming. If you can't bear our pain, then it's better to be quiet. Good things to say are: I'm sorry, I'm here, I'm listening. But the absolute best is--me too.

tweet: There are multiple autistic people in my family, and so this is something that will be a part of my life forevermore! And I'm so glad to learn more, especially from autistic people themselves. What a gift! And what a long, long way we have to go as a society.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Also I should be really clear and say I have *not* been diagnosed as autistic but I am exploring the possibility in therapy with an autistic therapist. Medical diagnosis is not accessible to many and is hard to come by in a racist, classist society.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: I think that culture at large is getting more comfortable (in some ways) with calling out abusers. But we have such a long, long way to go when it comes to dealing with enablers, and the social forces which push us to protect images and institutions instead of vulnerable people.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Most of us (hopefully) will not be abusers. But most of us, at some point or another, will be called upon to be enablers. What are you going to do in that situation? Will you uphold institutions or powerful friends? Or will you honor accountability and courageous whistleblowers?

description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Nobody I know and have advocated for has made it out of Afghanistan. Winter is coming and food is scarce and the Taliban is on the hunt for people. I don't let myself think about it very often, but how can I forget? It haunts my friend. It haunts her community.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: I have heard so many sad stories. Been sent so many horrific pictures. I have gathered info and filled out forms and emailed and called my senators and spent hours texting with people in Afghanistan, worried I was giving them false hope. Which, in a way, I was.

tweet: I knew two women who were visiting in Afghanistan with their families (including small kids) who eventually got out through harrowing circumstances. But what is worse are the dozens and dozens of family members who were in process of being resettled and who were abandoned.

tweet: One of my closest friends is a woman who was resettled under an SIV in 2015 from Afghanistan. The past few months have been excruciating as I have tried to do what I could to help various people in my city advocate for family members to get to safety.

tweet: Anyways I've deconstructed a lot but not the basic tenants of Christianity. And it's important for me to say that. I left because I don't want to belong to a toxic, patriarchal, white supremacist institution who proclaims to welcome everyone (as long as they conform!)

tweet: The pastors out here are saying we left because we don't like Jesus. NOPE. We left because you pushed us out when we started pointing out who wasn't allowed near the top of the hierarchy of you institution.

tweet:
Keller's tweet simply isn't true. 

SO MANY PEOPLE claim to crown Jesus as Lord of their lives and they ignore almost every single thing Jesus said when it comes to being a person in the world.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: A great place to start is The Sermon on the Mount in Matthew 5. Luke 4 is also pretty clear (as was the book of Isaiah). So is Matthew 25. The Sermon on the Plain is often overlooked (because of the woes) but again--quite clear of what your life/society could look like.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: Behind religious language is often the desire to not take the actual life and words of Jesus very seriously. Since my professors could never give me the specificity I craved, I went to the Bible. And Jesus is pretty clear about the practical applications of his ethics!

tweet: I spent an entire semester of Bible college pressing my professor on what this type of statement actually MEANT for the real world. I knew SO many people who would say this, sing songs about it--but they were just as petty, mean, traumatized, greedy, as everybody else. https://t.co/tJMRArDqas

In some ways it's so much easier to dismiss--that can't possibly be Christian!

What is so much harder is to say yes it is. And I am connected to it by the threads of our commonality. And now what is my responsibility to those who claim the name of Christ but do violence?

tweet: I like to think Rachel Held Evans is our patron saint. She had so many gold stars. And once her questions started pouring out, they didn't stop. Nor did her love or her desire to create spaces for all to be truly welcomed in with their questions.

tweet: It's not really community at all. And if you are in this position, or if you (like me) have experienced the loss of relationship because of your questions, I'm so sorry. The only comfort I can give you is that you aren't alone, and you CAN find people who value real community.

tweet: Julie is such a grace-filled person that she shephards us through these conversations in ways that invite interrogation, reflection, and repentance. And she also exposes the abusive elements underlying the way gay people have been treated by Christians--especially side B folks.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: It's really hard to talk about this stuff--and I know many people like myself were quiet(er) about our affirming stances because we didn't want to hurt friends or people who were side B (or dismiss their testimonies). But the complexities of this issue need to be brought to light

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: This book is especially poignant for anyone who has been in communities or relationship with "side B" Christians (ppl who identify as gay but are committed to celibacy or being in an opposite sex marriage).

tweet: Here's a bit more about Taylor. I'm beyond grateful for his work and witness in Oregon. His moral clarity is a light in our lives. https://t.co/sWqvP6Mi3h

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet:
In our lifetimes, we can do this. We must do this. 

Taylor Stewart and @OregonRemembra1 are fighting for this in Oregon. I know there are places in your state doing the same work. Let's join them. Let's end the death penalty this year. For good.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: To allow the history of racial terror in the US to really move us, we must act in response. We must look at our current systems of racial terror in the face and say NO MORE. We must fight with everything within us to end the death penalty, and to end mass incarceration.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Taylor's point was that we can take the stories of people like Alonzo Tucker and make a memorial for him and feel sad for a little bit and then feel better because we "did something." This is what I did. But this is missing the entire point.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: We have enslaved, exploited, terrorized and now routinely incarcerate and execute Black people in the US. And we accept it. Every day we just live here and accept that this is how the United States works, and this is our view of justice.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Imagine if Germany had the death penalty and 40% of the people on death row were Jewish (but nearly all the judges/lawyers were not). We would find that morally reprehensible, right? Well, that is what the state of the US death penalty is right now.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Taylor told us that Germany no longer has the death penalty. They recognize they don't have the moral capacity to determine who gets to live and who gets to die after their history of genocide and anti-semitism. Why has the US not done the same?

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Over 40% of the people on death row are Black (they make up 13% of the general population). Many many many people have been wrongfully convicted and wrongfully executed, the majority of them Black.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Taylor said it wasn't enough just to mourn and memorialize victims of racial terror in the US in the past. We memorialize, mourn, and then we fight like hell to stop the current racialized terror happening. Which is the death penalty in the US.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Here's where it gets really profound for me. Taylor came and spoke at my church @CascadePDX_  yesterday. He talked about Oregon's history of racial violence in the form of lynching--but then he started speaking about the death penalty.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Here you can find out more about the project/you can attend in person or watch the ceremony online. There were around 300 people at the lynching of Alonzo and Taylor wants more than 300 there to watch the memorialization of the space. https://t.co/mXriLthdX8

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Taylor has been working tirelessly to get something permanent put in place in Coos Bay. Working with the city council and more (no easy feat!). And on Saturday, June 19th, there is going to be a ceremony where an actual plaque and memorial is put up for Alonzo. https://t.co/8o8MMO0P2B

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: A year or so after I visited and was moved by the work at the @eji_org a young man from Portland named Taylor Stewart also went there, and was similarly moved to come back to Oregon and work on getting a monument/memorial for Alonzo Tucker. He started @OregonRemembra1.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: All of this--my awareness of racial terror in the PNW, my desire to see memorials that highlight that history--came from visiting Bryan Stevenson's Equal Justice Initiative in Alabama.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: The piece I wrote for CT was fine, but it was an excruciating process to try and write about this subject through the lens of patriarchal whiteness (I had to find expert theologians in a particular tradition to say/quote what I wanted to say). https://t.co/o9HzhbtFOH

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: My family and I actually drove 5 hours to Coos Bay (on the southern coast of Oregon) and awkwardly put up our own memorial to Alonzo Tucker, the only recorded Black man lynched in Oregon, because there wasn't anything there for him. Here's what we put up: https://t.co/2qSB8qf8vR

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: So many moons ago (2017) I wrote a cover story for Christianity Today on the history of racial terror in the US and a theology of monuments and memorials. I wrote a little about that process here: https://t.co/f2Q5KvIckI

tweet: Ramona Quimby taught me and a whole lot of other girls that the highest aim in life is not to be good, or to be quiet. It's to be present--in worry, in struggle, in delight. If my daughter comes out of childhood with these same lessons learned, I will consider it all a success.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: That stubborn child fell in love with the books but didn't want me to know. I didn't take it too hard, because she is a Ramona after all. The world is a little too unfair for her, so she needs to be able to find her solace and satisfaction where she can get it.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: Anyways, she refused to read them and then in second grade one day her teacher casually mentioned how cute it was to see Ramona reading Beverly Cleary books every day. What's that? I said. That's when I found out she was secretly reading them at school.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering
description: D.L. Mayfield. There she goes again, off to write her hit song â€œAlone in My Principlesâ€. she/her ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ welcome!  #actuallyautistic BLM. Dorothy Day book 11/22
tweet: "I am NOTHING like that Ramona" my Ramona would tell me, glaring at me with her arms crossed. She ignored the myriad of thrift store copies we had lying around of the series. Inside I would feel almost helpless with delight, because this is EXACTLY WHAT RAMONA QUIMBY WOULD SAY.

name: D.L. Mayfield is Wintering

tweet: My Ramona taught herself to read at age 3. So I started pushing the Ramona Quimby books on her early, like a drug dealer or something. Trying to get her hooked when she was 5 and 6. But she refused to bite.

tweet: I was hoping my daughter would have half as much spunk as Ramona Quimby--and boy, did we pick a good name for her. Right out of the gate she had opinions, she was worried, she was mad about stuff--and she delighted in all sorts of things.

tweet: So for me following Jesus hasn't meant that I am simply affirming of gay marriage. It means that in my life I now consistently prioritize the life and work and witness of gay Christians because they teach me so much about the love of God.

tweet: The Bible wasn't meant to be a playbook for my modern experience. But it did introduce me to Jesus, and his ethic of neighborliness AND his image of the invisible God who throws open the gates to the kingdom to all.

tweet: Now let's get to Jesus. Jesus was (in my limited view) obsessed with neighborliness, identifying power structures and who has been left out of places of authority, including spiritual authority. And he always points to them as the way forward for people wanting to love God.

tweet: We must ask for apologies that name the harm, center the victims, and have clear pathways forward towards reparations for the victims. Especially if the person doing the image management tactic has a powerful platform.
